title: epi2me-labs/wf-metagenomics
description: General purpose metagenomics workflow using kraken2 and/or minimap2

core_options.title: Core options
core_options.description: Define where the pipeline should find input data and save output data.

fastq.description: A fastq file or directory containing fastq input files or directories of input files.
fastq.help_text: If directories named \"barcode*\" are found under the `--fastq` directory the data is assumed to be multiplex and each barcode directory will be processed independently. If `.fastq(.gz)` files are found under the `--fastq` directory the sample is assumed to not be multiplexed. In this second case `--samples` should be a simple name rather than a CSV file.

out_dir.description: Directory for output of all user-facing files.

sample.description: A sample name for non-multiplexed data. Permissible if passing a file or directory of .fastq(.gz).

sample_sheet.description: CSV file with columns named `barcode`, `sample_name` and `type`. Permissible if passing a directory containing barcodeXX sub-directories.

store_dir.description: Where to store initial download of taxonomy database.

source.description: Sets the default reference, databases and taxonomy used. Choices: ['TARGLOCI']

sources.description: A map containing the available sources and their default resource paths

taxonomy.description: Optionally override the taxonomy used [.tar.gz or Dir]

minimap2_options.title: Minimap2 options

ref2taxid.description: Specifically override ref2taxid mapping. Format is .tsv (refname  taxid), no header row.

minimap2filter.description: Filter output of minimap2 by taxids inc. child nodes, E.g. "9606,1404"

minimap2exclude.description: Invert minimap2filter and exclude the given taxids instead

split_prefix.description: Enable if using a very large reference with minimap2

minimap2_options.help_text:
Minimap2
The default strategy is using minimap2 to perform full
alignments against .fasta formatted references sequences.

kraken2_options.title: Kraken2 options
kraken2_options.help_text:
Kraken2
It is possible to enable classification by kraken2, 
and disable alignment which is a faster but coarser method of 
classification reliant on the presence of a kraken2 database.

Using kraken2 + minimap2
If both are enabled and --kraken2minimap is set, only reads 
classified by kraken2 (and  optionally filtered by --kraken2filter) 
are passed to the alignment step.

kraken2exclude.description: Invert kraken2exclude and exclude the given taxids instead

kraken2minimap.description: Run minimap2 only on reads classified by Kraken2

bracken_dist.description: Specifically override bracken kmer dist file

bracken_length.description: Set the length value bracken will use

watch_path.description: Specify if you want the workflow to continuously process input files as they become available in the input --fastq directories.

read_limit.description: Use with watch_path if you don't want workflow to run indefinitely, will STOP pipeline when this number of reads have been processed.,

batch_size.description: Number of fastq files to process in each batch

port.description: Port number for the kraken server to use

bracken_level.description: Set the level that bracken will output at

generic_options.title: Generic options
generic_options.description: Less common options for the pipeline, typically set in a config file.
generic_options.help_text:
These options are common to all nf-core pipelines and allow you to customise some of the core preferences for how the pipeline runs.

Typically these options would be set in a Nextflow config file loaded for all pipeline runs, such as `~/.nextflow/config`.

threads.description: Set max number of threads to use. Note: limited by config executor cpus.

disable_ping.description: Enable to prevent sending a workflow ping.

docs.intro:
## Introduction

wf-metagenomics offers two different approaches to assigning sequence reads to a species:

### Kraken2 

[Kraken2](https://github.com/DerrickWood/kraken2) is used with the [Kraken2-server](https://github.com/epi2me-labs/kraken2-server) to offer the fastest method for classification of reads. [Bracken](https://github.com/jenniferlu717/Bracken) is then used to give a good estimate of species level abundance in the sample. This part of the workflow can be run in real time. See quickstart below for more details.

### Minimap2 

[Minimap2](https://github.com/lh3/minimap2) provides the finest resolution analysis but, depending on the reference database used, at the expense of significantly more compute time. Currently this method does not support real-time.

The wf-metagenomics workflow by default uses the NCBI 16S + 18S rRNA database that will be downloaded at the start of an analysis, there are expanded metagenomic database options available with the --source parameter but the workflow is not tied to this database and can also be used with custom databases as required.
